SEG.ORIGINAL_TEXT: Key Provisions of Patriot Act Have Expired - Thank You Edward Snowden & Rand Paul

It's official. Thanks in large part to Edward Snowden's revelations, beginning in June 2013, and the largest balls in Congress(belonging to Rand Paul,) the Beast has been forced to back down on some of the abuses assailed against our Constitution.
I want to publicly thank these two gentlemen for their bravery, especially Edward Snowden, who paid the ultimate price to shed light on this criminal enterprise.
Separated from family and friends, for my sake, Edward Snowden is my hero.
God Bless Edward Snowden, and may the earth curse his enemies until Doomsday with every plague imaginable, under Heaven.

Make no mistake, as the snow that usually falls in the Sierra was removed("reversed" <a href="http://www.internationalskeptics.com/forums/showpost.php?p=9909886&amp;postcount=280" target="_blank"><font color="#FF8C00">("reversed")</font></a> ) this year, and placed where the Pilgrims landed <a href="http://www.unexplained-mysteries.com/forum/index.php?showtopic=277408&amp;#entry5430464" target="_blank"><font color="#FF8C00">Pilgrims landed,</font></a> , I will reverse the fortunes of the United States and her people.

USA Freedom Act ... is nearly to the President's desk. It is a noxious fig leaf ... because it deputizes the telecoms to keep all your metadata ... so that the NSA doesn't have to do that ... it privatizes part of the Patriot Act. I am sure the telecoms will continue to do a great job in protecting your metadata from overly broad warrants from the NSA warrant court. Perhaps the NSA realized that keeping their server farm in Utah going, would be more trouble than it is worth, but now will generously allow telecom users to pay increased service charges while the telecoms are forced to keep exponentially increasing storage.

The British attack on private encryption is a red herring ... a weapon of mass distraction and stress. Actually hacking is done just before encryption or just after decryption. To actually prohibit even strong encryption would require the termination of Excel spreadsheets and knowledge of elementary maths. It isn't necessary to actually intercept every communication, one merely has to get people to believe that it is happening. Similar with encryption ... it isn't necessary to actually break every encryption, one merely has to convince people that it is futile. Psyops.

I don't see any of that in the history of the development of the internet, anywhere and I am specifically talking about before it went public. I'm not saying GB wasn't out of the loop but the first workable over the wire transmissions were here in the US with DARPA involvement and the contributions of Donald Davies. None of that wipes out what Vinton Cerf and Robert Kahn did later in putting it all together into a workable solution everyone could communicate on(the actual "internet").

Before all that the first "node" was established in 1969 at UCLA, the birth of ARAPNET. IPPS didn't come out until 1978. Joe Licklider came up with the original idea of an "intergalactic computer network" and was heavily involved in the early stages of development which was heavily funded by the US government.

My comments were also in relation to yours regarding squeezing out the government spying on us through it. The earliest stages until the internet as we know it went public were very heavily funded by the US Department of Defense and my family made a good chunk of change supplying a lot of the supplies needed to build the computers, servers and nodes necessary. The government won't get out of it, ever. Just because bits of the Patriot Act have expired the governments tentacles are all over the place. Don't think they didn't have back ups put in place already.
Justice ... don't be so naive. Tor is a CIA program ... a honey pot, particularly for following Chinese dissidents.

DD - I suspect that GB was involved in the later stages of the Internet development. They are the primary of the Five Eyes. And they are involved with CERN ... which developed the web browser. They needed to head off the French system controlled by the French telephone office (see 1980s).

DD - really? The Patriot Act expired? Three little parts of it for a few days (and then they announced the massive hack of government employees ... coincidence?). Then they put the Son of Patriot Act quickly thru.
